thread.title: Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to Android app
thread.title_full: Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to Android app

title: Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to Android app
text:
Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to - KiiiTV.com South Texas, Corpus Christi, Coastal Bend Member Center: Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to Android app Updated: Starbucks goes nationwide with mobile ordering, adds feature to Android app Next time you're craving a Starbucks coffee, skip the line and order ahead. Starbucks has rolled out its mobile ordering feature to all 7,400 stores in the U.S. More >> Next time you're craving a Starbucks coffee, skip the line and order ahead. Starbucks has rolled out its mobile ordering feature to all 7,400 stores in the U.S. More >> Kickstarter is now legally obligated to do good for society The crowdfunding platform Kickstarter is reincorporating as a public benefit corporation, which means that it is now bound by law to make a "positive impact on society." More >> The crowdfunding platform Kickstarter is reincorporating as a public benefit corporation, which means that it is now bound by law to make a "positive impact on society." More >> Most Americans still find new music on the radio Neilsen reports that the majority of music listeners still find new bands through the airwaves, and are extremely unlikely to pay for streaming music in the near future. More >> Neilsen reports that the majority of music listeners still find new bands through the airwaves, and are extremely unlikely to pay for streaming music in the near future. More >> Microsoft pledges $75 million towards youth computer science Microsoft has reiterated its commitment to fostering the next generation of computer science, with a $75 million investment in teaching programs set to roll out over the next three years. More >> Microsoft has reiterated its commitment to fostering the next generation of computer science, with a $75 million investment in teaching programs set to roll out over the next three years. More >> Apple’s HomeKit gets an update along with iOS 9 Apple released an iOS 9 update on Wednesday that included a few upgrades to HomeKit, along with the other changes such as including the ability to work remotely using iCloud, no Apple TV needed. More >> Apple released an iOS 9 update on Wednesday that included a few upgrades to HomeKit, along with the other changes such as including the ability to work remotely using iCloud, no Apple TV needed. More >> Rose gold iPhone 6S Plus the favorite among early buyers Demand for the new iPhone 6S and iPhone 6S Plus appears to be brisk, with the larger rose gold model apparently a particular favorite. More >> Demand for the new iPhone 6S and iPhone 6S Plus appears to be brisk, with the larger rose gold model apparently a particular favorite. More >> The latest feature of GetMyBoat, called “Sleep Aboard,” allows guests to be lulled to sleep by the gentle rocking motion of the waves beneath. More >> Can Eddie Redmayne bag back-to-back Oscars? From an ALS-stricken physicist to an LBGT icon. Eddie Redmayne transforms again in 'The Danish Girl,' leaving the industry to wonder whether he can win his second Oscar in a row. More >> From an ALS-stricken physicist to an LBGT icon. Eddie Redmayne transforms again in 'The Danish Girl,' leaving the industry to wonder whether he can win his second Oscar in a row. More >> Some hotels now offering perks to fight discount sites Large conglomerates like Hyatt and Hilton are now offering various incentives to customers to book through the hotels directly, rather than going through sites like Expedia or other third-party discount travel companies. More >> Large conglomerates like Hyatt and Hilton are now offering various incentives to customers to book through the hotels directly, rather than going through sites like Expedia or other third-party discount travel companies. More >> Tesla installs its 500th Supercharger station Tesla Motors crossed a bit of a milestone recently when the automaker installed its 500th Supercharger station in Moers, Germany. Tesla claims its Superchargers can provide 170 miles of range with just a 30-minute charge. More >> Tesla Motors crossed a bit of a milestone recently when the automaker installed its 500th Supercharger station in Moers, Germany. Tesla claims its Superchargers can provide 170 miles of range with just a 30-minute charge. More >> By Robert Nazarian Provided by Are you fed up with going to your local Starbucks only to stand in line? Well fret no more because you can now place your order via your smartphone at any of the 7,400 locations across the U.S. The service was previously available in limited areas with the plan for a full rollout around the holidays. Starbucks executives said the feature was so popular that they accelerated the expansion . It’s only available in the U.S., but the company plans on extending mobile orders to limited stores in Canada and the U.K. next month. Related: Starbucks partners with Lyft on shared loyalty program The order ahead service initially rolled out last year with a very limited number of stores, and expanded to about 4,000 in June. These trials were only available to Apple devices, but with today’s full expansion, Starbucks has added the feature to the Android app as well. Customers already had the ability to pay for orders via the mobile app on both iOS and Android . These mobile payments represent about 20 percent of all Starbucks’ U.S. transactions. The problem was that while customers didn’t have to fumble for their wallets, they still had to stand in line, which defeated the purpose. Now with the addition of ordering ahead, customers don’t have to wait in line or fumble for their wallet. That’s a win-win. RBC Capital Markets estimates that about 15 percent of all sales during the trial in the Pacific Northwest were from mobile ordering. Even more interesting is the fact that mobile orders are typically 15 percent higher than nonmobile orders. Seeing how these customers are willing to spend more, it’s no surprise that Starbucks plans to add suggestive selling features to the app to entice more purchases. What’s next for Starbucks? The company is already testing deliveries from faster express stores in New York City. Now that would be the ultimate form of convenience. Download the Starbucks mobile app from either the App Store or Google Play .
